description: Fertilizer equivalency knowledge base for agricultural input substitution recommendations

fertilizer_types.description: High-nitrogen fertilizer, most commonly used for rice and corn

substitutes.usage_note: Need 2.19 kg of Ammonium Sulfate to match 1 kg of Urea for nitrogen content

advantages: Provides sulfur (24%) which is beneficial for rice and vegetables
Less nitrogen loss through volatilization compared to Urea
Slower release reduces risk of nitrogen burn
disadvantages: Requires more bags (2.19x) making transport heavier
Acidifies soil over time - not suitable if pH is already low (<5.5)
More expensive per nitrogen unit in some regions
agronomic_notes.application_timing: Split application: 50% at basal (before planting), 50% at tillering (2-3 weeks after planting)

farmer_instructions.english: Replace {original_amount} bags of Urea with {substitute_amount} bags of Ammonium Sulfate. Apply half before planting and half after 2-3 weeks.
farmer_instructions.tagalog: Palitan ang {original_amount} sakong Urea ng {substitute_amount} sakong Ammonium Sulfate. Ilagay ang kalahati bago magtanim at ang kalahati pagkatapos ng 2-3 linggo.

substitutes.validated_by: Bureau of Soils and Water Management (BSWM)

substitutes.usage_note: Need 3.29 kg of Complete 14-14-14 to match 1 kg of Urea for nitrogen content

advantages: Provides balanced NPK nutrition (nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium)
Reduces need for separate P and K fertilizers
Good for newly cultivated or marginal lands
disadvantages: Significantly more expensive (approximately 50% higher cost per bag)
May over-apply phosphorus and potassium if soil already has adequate levels
Not nitrogen-efficient - paying for nutrients you may not need
Requires much more bags (3.29x) - storage and transport issues
not_recommended_for: established rice fields with adequate P-K levels
agronomic_notes.application_timing: Basal application only (incorporate into soil 1-2 weeks before planting)

farmer_instructions.english: Replace {original_amount} bags of Urea with {substitute_amount} bags of Complete 14-14-14. Apply all before planting and mix well with soil.
farmer_instructions.tagalog: Palitan ang {original_amount} sakong Urea ng {substitute_amount} sakong Complete 14-14-14. Ilagay lahat bago magtanim at haluin sa lupa.

cost_consideration.cost_impact_note: Complete fertilizer is 50% more expensive per bag. Total cost will be approximately 5x higher due to conversion factor.

substitutes.validated_by: Department of Agriculture - Bureau of Agricultural Research

incompatible_substitutes.reason: Contains zero nitrogen (0-0-60) - cannot substitute for nitrogen needs
incompatible_substitutes.error_message: ❌ Muriate of Potash provides only potassium, not nitrogen. Cannot replace Urea.

incompatible_substitutes.reason: Contains zero nitrogen (0-18-0) - only provides phosphorus
incompatible_substitutes.error_message: ❌ Solophos provides only phosphorus, not nitrogen. Cannot replace Urea.

fertilizer_types.description: Balanced NPK fertilizer for general crop nutrition

substitutes.usage_note: Need 12.5% less of 16-16-16 due to higher concentration

advantages: Slightly more concentrated - less bags needed
disadvantages: May be slightly more expensive per bag
Less commonly available in some areas

farmer_instructions.english: Replace {original_amount} bags of Complete 14-14-14 with {substitute_amount} bags of Complete 16-16-16. Apply before planting.
farmer_instructions.tagalog: Palitan ang {original_amount} sakong Complete 14-14-14 ng {substitute_amount} sakong Complete 16-16-16. Ilagay bago magtanim.

fertilizer_types.description: Nitrogen and sulfur fertilizer, excellent for rice in sulfur-deficient soils

substitutes.usage_note: Need only 0.46 kg of Urea to match 1 kg of Ammonium Sulfate for nitrogen

advantages: Much fewer bags needed (less than half)
Generally lower cost per nitrogen unit
disadvantages: Does not provide sulfur - may need separate sulfur source
Higher volatilization losses if not incorporated properly
Not as effective in alkaline soils
agronomic_notes.application_timing: Split application with proper incorporation to reduce losses

farmer_instructions.english: Replace {original_amount} bags of Ammonium Sulfate with {substitute_amount} bags of Urea. Apply in split doses.
farmer_instructions.tagalog: Palitan ang {original_amount} sakong Ammonium Sulfate ng {substitute_amount} sakong Urea. Ilagay nang paisa-isa.

fertilizer_types.description: High-potassium fertilizer for fruit development and plant vigor
fertilizer_types.note: Potassium fertilizers are specialized - no common substitutes in typical municipal inventory

rice.reasoning: Rice requires high nitrogen during vegetative and reproductive stages. Urea is most cost-effective. AmSul provides bonus sulfur for protein synthesis.

split_application_schedule.tillering: 30-40% of total N (14-21 days after transplanting)
split_application_schedule.panicle_initiation: 20-30% of total N (35-42 days after transplanting)

corn.reasoning: Corn is heavy nitrogen feeder. Balanced nutrition important for yield.

split_application_schedule.v6_stage: 50% of total N (6-leaf stage, ~30 days after emergence)

vegetables.reasoning: Vegetables need balanced NPK. Complete fertilizers preferred unless soil test shows adequate P and K.
vegetables.application_note: Apply complete fertilizer at basal, supplement with urea during growth if needed

decision_rules.name: Primary Urea Substitution Rule
decision_rules.rationale: Ammonium Sulfate is the most agronomically sound and cost-effective substitute for Urea

decision_rules.name: Secondary Urea Substitution Rule
decision_rules.rationale: If AmSul unavailable, Complete 14-14-14 can substitute but at higher cost
decision_rules.warning: Inform user of significantly higher cost and potential P-K over-application

decision_rules.name: Complete Fertilizer Interchangeability
decision_rules.rationale: Nearly identical formulation - direct substitute with minor dosage adjustment

decision_rules.name: No Substitute Available
decision_rules.rationale: No viable substitutes available - must waitlist or reduce allocation per farmer
alternative_actions: Request emergency allocation from Regional Office
Offer partial allocation (if some stock remains)

decision_rules.name: Crop Suitability Check
decision_rules.rationale: Ensure substitute is agronomically appropriate for the specific crop

sources: PhilRice Technical Bulletin No. 15 (2020) - Fertilizer Management for Rice
Bureau of Soils and Water Management - Nutrient Management Guidelines
Fertilizer and Pesticide Authority (FPA) - Registered Fertilizer Database
metadata.validation_notes: All conversion factors and agronomic recommendations validated by Philippine agricultural research institutions
metadata.update_frequency: Review annually or when new research findings published
